original_title: Engine drivers call off train strike
original_body_lines: The train strike launched by the engine drivers attached to the powerset train running shed in Maradana was called off a short while ago.
The union had taken the decision following a discussion held with the Railways General Manager (GMR).
An official from the union said the GMR came to an agreement with the demands of the union.
A total of 26 train services, including office trains, were cancelled today due to the strike.
Even though the strike has been called off, there would be a delay in train operations, which would be restored by tomorrow morning, the official said.
Railway employees commenced the trade union action last evening (23) by applying for medical leave.
